body: It looks like this resolved itself today, I have no idea why :laughing:
Currently debugging a similar sounding issue on IRC so you're probably not the only one.

issue.title: syncing is stuck.
issue.body:
the folder is showing as up to date.  however it shows 12GB out of sync.  running the latest version on both sides.
![screenshot 2015-04-09 19 28 50](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8158602/7081032/a270ec18-def0-11e4-91be-63e6a26ec1f3.png)

body: (Could we be setting `prevVersion` in the puller when we shouldn't, so that we don't retry the pull until something triggers a new `localVersion`? That issue referenced about kind of sounds like it.)

Observe incoming index updates not causing `syncing` state for `Photos`:


issue.title: Synchronization stuck at 86%

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
In the visual feedback in the devices section:
![auswahl_001](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3252315/7238361/0e01667e-e7a2-11e4-9ede-ab8e09e7152c.png)
Archlinux 3.19.3

body: Mostly confirmed, as introducing any change into the Photos folder made the sync restart and continue.

issue.title: TestSyncClusterWithoutVersioning does not complete [Windows]

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
http://build.syncthing.net/job/syncthing-windows-integration/116/console
